CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 30, 1958, pg. 4, reads: "Sin Den Murder Site - During a dispute over the purchase of a drink for a woman, 29-year-old Jonathan Cobbs of 701 Chauncey St., was killed by a stab wound in the chest from a knife in the hands of Raymond Bryant, 30, of Arthur St., early Sunday morning on the porch of the Juicy Plum Club (left photo), a speakeasy, located on the second floor of this building at 1719 Centre Ave. and Roberts St., according to police. Entrance to the steps leading into the club is gained through a doorway in an eight-foot high wooden fence on the Roberts St. side of the building... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Centre Avenue and Roberts Street with Around the Clock sandwich shop, George's Hat Cleaning, storefront with sign reading "Learners Permits 24 hours apply here," and man in entrance to Juicy Plum Club speakeasy at 1719 Centre in background, Hill District
